title: Why can't iTunes always get the album artwork for an album I add? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s because iTunes is very buggy software that just doesn’t work reliably and Apple doesn’t care enough to fix it, I’ve experienced this off and on for several years and there’s no help or solutions anywhere. The only option is to tediously add the artwork one album at a time. As near as I can ascertain, “Get Album Artwork” used to just look for the current album, but it was changed to go get artwork for all albums with missing artwork. If any of them throws an exception it fails silently and nothing happens. It used to tell you if the artwork was unavailable, but now when you click on “Get Album Artwork” nothing happens. This is just textbook piss-poor application design. But it’s Apple, so not unsurprising.

Usually it’s an issue with the album’s meta-data that causes it to not match up exactly with how the album is listed in the iTunes Store. Misspelled words, punctuation - you name it. In some cases, it can just be that that exact album isn’t available in the store, so there isn’t anything to match. (This is a lot rarer now than it used to be, as the iTunes Store is fairly comprehensive for the last 20 years of music.) Clean up your id3 tags so that they match the album as it is listed in the store and you will have 100% success in my experience. If the album isn’t in the store, you can manually add the artwork, which can usually be found with a quick google image search.
